intro: Trochetia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered trochetia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Trochetia parviflora is often found in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes.
